content.description: Amazing views of the mine and valley while climbing.  Can be windy. Need to build your own anchor for top rope.  Can easily walk up to the top from the left or right side of the face.
content.protection: No top anchors.Gear to #1, tricams helpful.
content.location: Located on the large red cliff visible upon first entering the mine.  Follows along an arete on the left.

content.description: Start by taking your first steps up the big rock to a platform at the beginning of the route. Then follow the diagonal cracks left for an easier climb, or just head straight up.  Around the half way point there are a couple of heavy, loose rocks on the left.  Stay right of these!  Shortly after this the face gets flat, so borrow a huge, obvious left jug from Princess Garnet, then veer right and cruise to the top.
content.protection: Looks like tricams would be handy, but we didn't try to lead.  Easy TR anchors with a quick walk-up.
content.location: 3 ft right of Princess Garnet and below it, at the base of the black ledge, below three thin left-diagonal cracks.  Left and Clifford the Big Red Dog.

content.description: Follow the right leaning crack to the shoulder, climb straight up the corner, then angle slightly left to the top! Just a little exposure on that right corner, which is perfect to awaken a sense of adventure in new climbers.  A little chossy on the shoulder, but very solid feet there.
content.protection: Many easy TR placements along the cliff edge for BD .5 to 1 with short extensions. Drop the rope from the side of a small ledge, climber's right of the peak, to minimize the pendulum (PG13 for this reason).
content.location: An obvious right leaning crack that begins a few feet right of Princess Garnet.

content.description: Abandoned mine on state property, free access to all.  Amazing red cliffs, great views, and lots of garnet everywhere!
